channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flyposters for monthly street market on pedestrian crossing poles, 4th June
item.description:
One poster attached each side of the road/pavement at the [edestrian crossing over the A40 by the entrance to Montpellier Park. This person flyposts almost every month, usually attaching flyposters to the railings around the park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposter - gardening competition on lampposts, 4th June
item.description:
Same person has put another two flyposters up on two lampposts at the junction between Pilley Lane, Old Bath Road and Everest Road. One is on the lamppost on Everest Rd as you enter the estate, the other is at the junction of Old bath Rd and Pilley Lane on left side as you start to go down Pilley Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 4th June
item.description:
Customer reports that there is large amounts of traffic building up on the Greenhills Road side of the lights, as they only seem to go green for 1 or 2 cars before turning red again
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Signage remains after works, 4th June
item.description:
Corner of Boulton Road and Swindon Lane. Sign on post stating 'road closed 27/28 May', 2 sandbags on verge, diversion sign left on verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Boulton Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Footbridge has been vandalised, 4th June
item.description:
It appears that someone has tried to destroy the footbridge. They have lit a fire on the bridge in what appears to be an attempt to destroy it. They have also broken the wooden spar at the front of the bridge and broken down the way marker post and thrown them in the stream. Without attention this bridge could become quite dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Bark Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip in the Pylons Car Park at the end of Cleeve Common Road, 4th June
item.description:
The location is the Pylons Car Park at the end of Cleeve Common Road - The material - mainly wood panels is on the right hand side near the Dog Bag Bin and over the edge of the location (see first photograph). It has been there for some time - please can it be cleared up together with a rubbish pick for the whole carpark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Path, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Subsidence than eroded Pothole at Location, 4th June
item.description:
The location is by the burnt Oak at the immediate entrance to Cleeve Common Road. The road has subsided and a lip hs formed at the far side of it which has gotten quite deep especially felt when it is hit - which is difficult to avoid. Please can it be repaired as to avoid means going towards the near side verge as the Cleeve Common Road is entered.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip in Layby On Cleeve Common Road, 4th June
item.description:
The location on the road above is a Layby / Woods Gate Entrance on the right hand side (a bulldozer has been put the other side of the gate to block it being opened) going towards Cleeve Common. The flytip appears to be mainly wood with other possible materials (as seen from a vehicle). Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign/waymarker is damaged problem, 4th June
item.description:
Style missing on boundary crossing near Black Barn. (see photo attached with no 1 marking missing style). GR 988316 Also no footpath signpost on gate (no 2 on photo). GR989315 Query re PROW at Mill Farm. GR033303. Is there PROW from the footpath to the minor adjacent road. Or is there no right of way pass gate boundary. Also noted that farmer at Mill Farm has put sign saying no dogs allowed on footpath. Is this correct?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dog poop near the pencil side of the wide element of the pavement. And further down same side of road by houses, 4th June
item.description:
Lots of dog poo outside the school side of the road and down by the houses. Residence purposely dont pick up their dog poo as they donâ€™t like parents dropping their kids off at the school next door so refuse to pick it up. More needs to be done, sign posts and fines for this. Its awful problem outside this school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dinglewell, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree limbs about to fall and damage property and fall on people, 4th June
item.description:
Cul de sac lawrence close charlton kings for a couple of years but getting worse. The driveways have been recently done and the branches are falling everytime a refuse truck bangs into them.
